thread.title: Webb drops out of Democratic presidential race
thread.title_full: Webb drops out of Democratic presidential race

title: Webb drops out of Democratic presidential race
text:
Webb drops out of Democratic presidential race 
Updated: Tue, Oct 20 2015, 01:41 PM 
By: The Associated Press WASHINGTON, D.C. -- Jim Webb says he is dropping out of the Democratic race for president and is considering his options about how he might "remain as a voice" in the campaign.The former Virginia senator says at a news conference that he is "withdrawing from any consideration" of becoming the Democratic party's nominee.Some reports indicated earlier Tuesday and on Monday Webb would consider running for president as an independent.He has complained that he did not get the chance to make his views fully known at the first Democratic debate.Webb has trailed badly in the field that includes Hillary Rodham Clinton and Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders. Webb has been polling in the back of the pack with former Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley and former Rhode Island Gov. Lincoln Chafee.The Iowa Democratic Party says Webb will not appear at Saturday's major Jefferson-Jackson fundraiser in Des Moines.Webb served as a senator in Virginia.Webb is the first Democrat of five announced candidates to drop from the 2016 presidential race. Two Republican candidates dropped out earlier this year, but 15 candidates remain in the race. Related Stories
